LanguageData.FT_PowerPole.label: power pole
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole.description: A concrete power pole, using tin or copper cables to carry an electrical current. Connect to other power poles using the 'link' button, or select multiple power poles and press the 'auto-link' button.
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Blueprint.label: power pole (blueprint)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Blueprint_Install.label: power pole (blueprint)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Frame.label: power pole (building)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Frame.description: A concrete power pole, using tin or copper cables to carry an electrical current. Connect to other power poles using the 'link' button, or select multiple power poles and press the 'auto-link' button.
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Lamp.label: power pole (street lamp)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Lamp.description: A concrete power pole, using tin or copper cables to carry an electrical current. Connect to other power poles using the 'link' button, or select multiple power poles and press the 'auto-link' button.
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Lamp_Blueprint.label: power pole (street lamp) (blueprint)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Lamp_Frame.label: power pole (street lamp) (building)
LanguageData.FT_PowerPole_Lamp_Frame.description: A concrete power pole, using tin or copper cables to carry an electrical current. Connect to other power poles using the 'link' button, or select multiple power poles and press the 'auto-link' button.
LanguageData.FT_DistributionBox.label: distribution box
LanguageData.FT_DistributionBox.description: A metal box on a concrete foundation connects to power networks via conduit to extend the range at which electronics can connect to said conduits. Proper implementation can triple the range at which electric current can be utilized.
